definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Vocalizing is a higher nervous activity of the human being.
sentences.chinese: 歌唱发声是人的一种高级神经活动。

sentences.english: The computerized talking dictionary, unparalleled in the world, is. a good assis. ant for your successful career.
sentences.chinese: 真人发声电脑辞典，独步天下，事业成功好帮手。

sentences.english: The Parktronic system operates on the echo-sounder principle.
sentences.chinese: 驻车定位系统根据回波发声器原理工作。

sentences.english: Chinchillas make a variety of vocalizations, including chirps, squeaks, and barks.
sentences.chinese: 龙猫作出了各种发声，包括呻吟，唧唧叫和哨音。

sentences.english: Disclosed is an automatic sounding and counting instrument for pulse which is a medical apparatus suitable for feeling the pulse in traditional Chinese medical treatment.
sentences.chinese: 脉搏自动发声计数仪是一种适于中医切脉的医疗器具。

sentences.english: We are very good at picking from very brief vocalization the effective state of a person.
sentences.chinese: 通过简单的发声我们就能够推测出一个人的实际状态。

sentences.english: You may mouth the words, but no sound must be uttered.
sentences.chinese: 在演唱时，你做出发音的口型就可以了，但不要发声。

sentences.english: He has been using a wheel chair for many years and speaks with the aid of a voice synthesizer.
sentences.chinese: 他多年来只能坐在轮椅上，借助发声器“讲话”。

sentences.english: Objective To study the relationship of functional phonation disorders and laryngeal organic diseases.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨功能性发声障碍与喉器质性病变的关系。

sentences.english: Your baby will begin to vocalize long before she can talk.
sentences.chinese: 你的女婴早在会说话之前就要开始咿呀发声了。

sentences.english: The computerized talking dictionary, unparalleled in the world, is a good assistant for your successful career.
sentences.chinese: 真人发声电脑辞典，独步天下，事业成功好帮手。

sentences.english: Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets
sentences.chinese: 智慧在街市上呼喊，在宽阔处发声。

sentences.english: After that, thorax shrink, the meatus of esophagus turn in again, the voice behavior is over.
sentences.chinese: 后胸廓缩小，食管入口黏膜再次内翻，发声结束。

sentences.english: Ma has hit back at Wang, accusing him of abandoning their family.
sentences.chinese: 事后，马蓉也发声反击，谴责王宝强抛妻弃子。

sentences.english: In response to a question about the American accent of his synthesiser .
sentences.chinese: 回应一个关于他的电子发声器的美国口音问题。

sentences.english: Vocalization should play a primary role in vocality teaching.
sentences.chinese: 在声乐教学中发声练习必须放在首位。

definition: clear (of liquid)/limpid/to clarify/to make sth clear/to be clear (about the facts)
to settle (of liquid)/to become clear (by precipitation of impurities)/precipitate (chemistry)/to put in order/to quell disturbances
to call on (sb to do sth)/to appeal (to)/an appeal
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to issue a document/document issued by an authority/outgoing messages/(Internet) to post an article online
to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
